Activity: Log in to the system, check emails, and review the overall project progress on EHR collection and influenza trend analysis. Address any urgent requests or updates from the team.
Review the goals for the week: focusing on clinical workflows for influenza data capture and implementing prompts for diagnosis and testing.

Meet with @rn-1, @rn-2, @rn-3, @pchmp-1 to discuss current clinical workflows related to influenza diagnosis, testing, and treatment. Gather feedback on potential areas for improvement and modification. @PEOPLE: Send email to nurses and physician champion to arrange a meeting.

Based on the discussion, begin identifying specific clinical workflows within the EHR that need to be modified to facilitate influenza data capture. Prioritize workflows based on their impact and feasibility.
Document the identified workflows and the proposed modifications. Outline the data points to be captured at each stage of the workflow.

Follow up with @ehrdev-1 and @ehrdev-2 about the feasibility and timeline for implementing the identified workflow modifications within the EHR system. Discuss any technical challenges or limitations.

Draft an initial design for implementing prompts for influenza diagnosis and testing into the physician examination workflow. Consider different prompt types (e.g., pop-up alerts, embedded questions) and their placement within the EHR interface. @PEOPLE: Send email to developers to discuss feasibility.

Collaborate with @his-1 and @his-2 to ensure that the data captured through the prompts aligns with the required data fields for influenza trend analysis. Discuss data standardization and coding conventions.
Review the day's progress and plan for tomorrow's activities. Address any pending issues or concerns.
